name: Addressing the challenges of partially distributed engineering teams
description: The tech industry has consistently demonstrated creativity and innovation in how work is structured. Companies like Automattic, GitLab, and others have long shared lessons on how fully distributed teams can be effective; decades of business books have addressed the challenges of leadership in co-located teams, but there isn’t as much published wisdom on leading partially distributed teams beyond the suggestion of treating them as fully distributed.

name: When, why, and how to stop coding as your day job
description: By letting go of writing code, you open yourself up to excelling as a manager.

name: Building a vernacular with your engineering team
description:
Whether written or spoken, words are essential – both the general terms we use and those specific to our work.

The terms and phrases that are specific to our jobs or our companies create a vernacular.

name: Fail Safe, Fail Smart, Succeed!
description: This article is about failure and everything I’ve learned from 28 years of failing (and succeeding) in the technology industry. Its basis is my talk of the same name that I first gave in 2015.

name: Succession for Scale
description: Build a culture that recognizes succession planning is critical not just for people leaving for other companies, but to help scale the company. Succession planning for scale requires looking outside the company as opposed to growing from within.

name: Taking a thoughtful approach to the job search process
description:
Does starting a job search fill you with fear? Have you taken roles in the past that you’ve regretted?

When a recruiter or interviewer asks you the question – ‘What are you looking for?’ – do you draw a blank?

Using a deliberate process will allow you to answer these questions without fear.

name: A resignation can be an opportunity
description:
People leave jobs. If you are a manager, people will leave your team, just as someday you will leave your team.

When this happens it’s an opportunity, a chance to re-evaluate. While you might want to immediately pull out the job description that you used when hiring for the role last time, instead, take some time to think.

name: Hiring Agile Coaches
description: Understanding the value of the Agile Coach role in an organization and considerations when introducing that as a new role to an existing team.

name: Changing Hiring Practices to Build a More Diverse Technology Organization, A Case Study from Avvo
description: Given current events, I hear from friends at tech companies that they are re-evaluating their lack of diversity. They want to improve. While companies have tried different tactics for years, we haven’t made much progress as an industry. If you are trying to address diversity for the first time, it is a daunting task. It is easy to try some things, make no progress, and then give up.

name: The Personal Strategy Off-site
description: If your company is starting to plan for getting back into your office, now is a good time for you to schedule a personal strategy day.

name: Living in an Employer’s Market as a Developer
description: The great thing about being in technology is that it is a growing field. There are tons of jobs, and companies are always complaining about how hard it is to find talent.</br></br>That is until it isn’t.

name: The Next Step
description: If you have a good job, a job that pays you well, a team you like working with, and a mission you believe in, deciding to move on from that role is challenging.

name: Agile at AstrumU: A Case Study
description: This article describes how we organize our work at AstrumU using a Scrumban process.

name: Using Self-Selection to Create Journey Teams at Avvo
description: Many companies are interested in experimenting with self-selection as a way of organizing their teams. I see questions about the process often in online forums. While there are some excellent books and blog posts on the topic, I thought that I would share a self-selection exercise that we did at my last company, Avvo. It worked reasonably well and with relatively little drama. If you are considering a similar exercise, you might consider this approach.

name: How I Get My Focused Work Done
description: Over the years, I’ve tried many different ways to improve my focused time. Here are the things that work best for me.

name: In 2018 Decide to Work Deliberately
description: What does it mean to live (and work) deliberately?

name: Building a Management Training Curriculum at Avvo
description: An approach to collectively determining the priorities for a team training program.

name: Thoughts on emulating Spotify’s matrix organization in other companies
description: I was in San Francisco in December for a conference. While I was there, I ended up connecting with a couple different companies who have been inspired by Henrik Kniberg’s whitepaper on Scaling Agile at Spotify, and who have been trying to do implement some of those ideas in their own companies.

name: The Spotify model: how to create, dissolve, and remix teams to be more dynamic and more innovative
description: One of the most challenging parts of managing a traditional, hierarchical, organization is being responsive to new opportunities; especially those that require leveraging skillsets outside your own team. At Spotify, our organizational model allows us to create, dissolve, and remix teams with a minimal disruption to individuals or managers. This gives us tremendous abilities to address both temporary and long term opportunities.

name: A diversity challenge: tech start-ups have a great opportunity
description: Large technology companies should still work consistently to improve their diversity, but startups are much better suited to solve the diversity problem for the industry as a whole.

name: Building a technical career path at Spotify
description: Spotify launched a career path framework for individuals last year. Since then, I’ve spoken to leaders at several other companies about it. This seems to be a bit of a hot topic, so I’ve decided to write about our model and how we arrived at it. Hopefully, this may be useful to your company.

name: Spotify Technology Career Steps
description: Spotify's first technology career pathing structure

name: Things We Learned Creating Technology Career Steps
description: The things we learned building a non-tradtional career pathing structure at a company which thrives on autonomy, servant leadership and strong teams

name: The Myth of the Startup in a Large Company
description: Can you really 'act like a startup' in the middle of a large, established, company?

name: Protecting your team from layoffs
description: Tips from eight years of managing in a layoff-prone company.

name: Leaving Avvo
description: It's been awesome, but it's time for the next thing. I'm leaving Avvo.

name: Leaving Spotify
description: Today is my third anniversary at Spotify. It has been an amazing adventure and a time that I will treasure, but it is time for me to move…

name: Building a Culture of Continuous Improvement
description: A culture of continuous improvement is a culture where you are always open to improving how you build and deliver. You don't accept the status quo; you choose how to work and feel empowered to change it if it no longer makes sense. It is a people-first culture.

name: Articles for the Pixel Bender Developer Center
description: A collection of articles for developers to help them understand and learn the Pixel Bender language created by my team at Adobe.
